note.p: Dutch lawyer and philanthropist. Studied law in Leiden, graduating in 1848. After travelling to London, set up his law practice in Middelburg. Took over his father’s wine-merchant business in 1853. Member of the Scientific Society of Zeeland, 1854; secretary, 1874–85. Supported local art, science, and museums, and also many philanthropic institutions. Travelled widely in Europe and Egypt.

p.hi: Jaarboek van de Maatschappij der Nederlandse Letterkunde 1900
